subject: Boats and Boating
Hockey, Ice
lead_paragraph: The United States Coast Guard suspended its aerial search for the daughter of Montreal Canadiens General Manager Bob Gainey last night, three days after she was washed overboard in the Atlantic Ocean during a storm while working on a sailing ship bound for the Caribbean. Laura Gainey was on the deck of the tall ship Picton Castle on Friday night when a large wave swept her overboard. Petty Officer Larry Chambers said the Coast Guard’s search about 475 miles off Cape Cod was suspended, but the Picton Castle would continue looking for her. Laura Gainey, 25, was thrown from the 180-foot boat without a lifejacket.
